name: amazon_bulk_search
description: Search multiple products on Amazon in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling amazon_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string. Example: 'wireless headphones,mechanical keyboard,usb hub'.

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('.s-result-item[data-asin]'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(items.length, 5); i++) { const el = items[i]; const asin = el.getAttribute('data-asin'); if (!asin) continue; const titleEl = el.querySelector('h2 a span, h2 span.a-text-normal'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('h2 a.a-link-normal'); const priceEl = el.querySelector('.a-price .a-offscreen'); const ratingEl = el.querySelector('.a-icon-star-small .a-icon-alt'); const reviewCountEl = el.querySelector('a[href*="#customerReviews"] span.a-size-base, a[href*="customerReviews"] span, .a-size-small .a-link-normal .a-size-base'); const primeEl = el.querySelector('.a-icon-prime, .s-prime'); const imgEl = el.querySelector('img.s-image'); const url = linkEl ? 'https://www.amazon.com' + linkEl.getAttribute('href') : ''; results.push({ title: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : '', price: priceEl ? priceEl.textContent.trim() : '', rating: ratingEl ? ratingEl.textContent.trim() : '', review_count: reviewCountEl ? reviewCountEl.textContent.trim() : '', has_prime: !!primeEl, image: imgEl ? imgEl.getAttribute('src') : '', url: url, asin: asin }); } const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); return { query: params.get('k') || '', result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
